entry.title: Headless: filter out empty arguments
entry.content:
Users might specify an empty argument by mistake and it gets

then treated as a file path resulting in an unexpected internal page

with unexpected console messages. It probably makes sense to default

to about:blank if no file path was explicitly provided (similar to no args).

entry.title: Fix missing/double callback in full card request
entry.content:
Only a single FullCardRequest can be processed at a time. This is

ensured in FullCardRequest::GetFullCard(), by checking whether a

result_delegate_ is already set. Like the code comment explains:

> If the member variable |result_delegate_| is already set, then

> immediately reject the new request through the method parameter



Unfortunately, the new request is not rejected through the method

parameter result_delegate. Instead, result_delegate_, the delegate

corresponding to the currently pending request, is called.



When this happens:

- The result delegate of the new request is never called, neither with

OnFullCardRequestSucceeded() nor with OnFullCardRequestFailed().

- The result delegate of the currently active request is called twice,

once with OnFullCardRequestFailed() and once with the result of the

request.



This bug has been around for several years (introduced by

codereview.chromium.org/2694073002), but hasn't manifested in crashes

until crrev.com/c/5029235 recently landed. Prior to the second CL, the

CCAM stored a pointer to an CCAM::Accessor, which was supposed to be

called only once with the result, but could be called multiple times

without crashing. The CL replaced it with a OnceCallback, which will

crash if called a second time.



Specifically, this caused the linked crash (see bug) in this case:

- A CVC authentication is triggered through CCAM::FetchCreditCard().

This sets the CCAM's on_credit_card_fetched_callback_ OnceCallback.

To perform the authentication, CreditCardCvcAuthenticator::

Authenticate() calls FullCardRequest::GetFullCard() with

CreditCardCvcAuthenticator as its result delegate.

- A FullCardRequest is triggered directly through different means,

like the iOS manual fill feature (whatever that is :)).

As described above, this calls the original request's

OnFullCardRequestFailed(). Since the delegate is the

CreditCardCvcAuthenticator, its OnFullCardRequestFailed() is called,

which loops the result back to the CCAM, invoking the OnceCallback.

- When the request actually finishes, the OnceCallback is invoked a

second time, causing the crash.



Fixed: 1515311

Change-Id: I3a4c594ad07227463d7412b998532c41cba563e0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5168526

Reviewed-by: Vinny Persky

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243326}

entry.title: Remove PersonalDataManagerObserver::OnInsufficientFormData()
entry.content:
The event is triggered on form submission, if the submitted form doesn't

contain sufficient data for an import. This event only has a single

test-related use, which this CL rewrites. Consequently, the event can be

removed.



In autofill_uitest_util, PdmChangeWaiter supposedly waits for

OnPersonalDataChanged() event. It also treats OnInsufficientFormData()

as an OnPersonalDataChanged() event. This allows writing code like this:

(fill form)

(submit form)

wait using PdmChangeWaiter

By treating OnInsufficientFormData() as OnPersonalDataChanged(), waiting

will stop after either data was successfully imported - or once it was

determined that no import is possible.

By removing OnInsufficientFormData(), all tests that don't import any

data wait forever.



This CL fixes this issue by instead:

- Waiting for submission to complete using TestAutofillManagerWaiter.

- Waiting until all pending DB tasks have completed, by posting a task

to the WebDataService's SequencedTaskRunner. If no import was

triggered, this will be the only task in the queue and it will return

immediately. If an import was triggered, since the form submission

logic has already completed, a pending task for the DB write will

currently be executing. In this case, the new queued task will only

finish after the async import task has finished.



The event is also referenced by some iOS code, which doesn't make use of

it.



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: Ie68e745ca28bb4d3e8fccd6b0c33b0c05b90cf13

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5158290

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Rohit Rao

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243323}

entry.title: [SharedImage] Make SkiaOutputSurfaceImplOnGPU GLES2 usage read-only
entry.content:
The usage bits here need to capture the variety of clients' eventual

usages, as these SharedImages serve as the destination for clients

making CopyOutputRequests. After discussion, we have concluded that

CopyOutputRequests should be read-only via GLES2 (as they are in

practice now). This CL makes that change.

entry.title: iwa: Fixed SignedWebBundleReader crash
entry.content:
In case when the desired file can't be opened by an instance of

SignedWebBundleReader we see a crash.

To fix it we check if the instance of `connection_` exists.

In addition the `connection_` reset was removed as there is almost no

profit from doing this but it creates a extra complexity. It is

simpler to assume that the `connection_` will be destroyed in the

Reader's destructor (similar to the RAII idiom).



Bug: b/318671239

Test: Added unit test

entry.title: [Android][WebAuthn] Specify WebAuthn mode in CaBLE authenticator
entry.content:
With the intro of WebauthnModeProvider, constructs which use

CredManHelper (and in the future Fido2Api, Fido2ApiCall, etc.)

need to specify the WebauthnMode. This is done in AuthenticatorImpl

already.



However CableAuthenticator does not use AuthenticatorImpl. Hence it

needs to set the mode itself.



Bug: 1511193

Change-Id: I333be77017539fdc44a07e5e2a0092c19b49bed4

entry.title: WebNN: Report detailed error messages from mojom::WebNNGraph::Compute
entry.content:
This CL re-defines `mojom::ComputeResult` as the return value of

`mojom::WebNNGraph::Compute()`, let it be `named_outputs` if the

computation was successful and `error` with detailed error messages

that can be exposed to JS for debugging use otherwise.



And this CL also let WebNN service report bad message error and

terminate the renderer if validating the inputs for computation fails.



Bug: 1507698,1273291

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in BoxLayoutView.
entry.content:
Several views inside NotificationViewBase created BoxLayoutViews,

but then proceeded to treat them as normal Views and reset their

LayoutManagers. Changing that allows to mark the raw pointer to the

LayoutManager in BoxLayoutView as not dangling.

entry.title: iwa: Use fake pref observer in IWA installer unittest
entry.content:
This CL decouples the IWAInstallerViewControllerTests from the pref

system by creating a fake pref observer that mimics the behavior of the

actual observer.



This reduces divergence in tests between different OSs and provides more

control of the test setup.



This allows us to simplify and re-enable tests for Lacros where test

setups were difficult due to the fact that the pref observation was done

through a crosapi pipeline.







Bug: 1508716

entry.title: [A11y] Do not remove subtrees for SetChildTreeId()
entry.content:
As of CL:5137975, changes to the "hidden by child tree" state now

propagates to descendants automatically.



The previous implementation for "hidden by child tree" changes is no

longer necessary. It removed the subtree of AXObjects in order to force

the AXObject for each node to reflect the new "hidden by child tree"

state (and dependent hidden/ignored/included states).

That implementation can now be removed, because merely kicking off

the OnInheritedCachedValuesChanged() is now sufficient to cause

the state changes to be inherited by all descendants.



Bug: none

entry.title: [A11y] Do not remove subtrees for aria-hidden changes
entry.content:
As of CL:5137975, aria-hidden changes now propagate to descendants.



The previous implementation for aria-hidden changes is no longer

necessary. It removed the subtree of AXObjects in order to force

the AXObject for each node to reflect the new aria-hidden value.

That implementation can now be removed, because merely marking the root

of the change dirty is now sufficient (which is the default behavior

for any aria-foo change).



Some additional fixes to state propagation were required:

1. Changes were made to overrides of AddChildren() to match the default

version of that method, which forces a call to

UpdatedCachedValuesIfNeeded(). Without these changes, we fail

wpt/accessibility/crashtests/aria-hidden-with-select.html (see

failure in patchset 1).

2. There was an early return in

AXObject::OnInheritedCachedValuesChanged() causing the

child_cached_values_need_update_ flag to not be set when the

children were already dirty. This error was already present but

unnoticed in the new inherited state propagation code, and relying

on that code more showed the issue via failed tests.



Event test expectations also changed, because subtrees of AXObjects

are now being reused in those cases.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ibc07ed76aa4ce8f6bbe662e5b4545e006d53f64c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169706

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243246}

entry.title: Do not round the clipping region with mixed overflow clip
entry.content:
The CSSWG resolved [1] to not apply rounded border clipping when one of

overflow-x or overflow-y computes to clip and the other computes to

visible (https://drafts.csswg.org/css-overflow/#corner-clipping). This

patch updates our implementation to not create the inner border radius

clip in this mixed clip/visible scenario.



[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7434



Bug: 1416649

entry.title: QA Rich Card: migrate to BoxLayout
entry.content:
For certain views, it's better to use BoxLayout instead of FlexLayout

to ensure the views remain correctly bounded. This specifically applies

to the horizontal children views of the rich card `content_view_` for

example. Migrate the applicable FlexLayout views to use BoxLayout.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Fix context menu options and saving for OOPIF PDF Viewer
entry.content:
Context menu handling and saving for plugins expects a GuestView or

nested WebContents. Preserve the same context menu options and

"Save As" function for OOPIF PDF Viewer, which does not use a GuestView

nor a nested WebContents.



If the PDF has edits, allow the OOPIF PDF Viewer to handle the save.

GuestView PDF Viewer also handles saving edited PDFs through

WebContentsDelegate, but avoid having to modify content/ for OOPIF PDF

Viewer by explicitly attempting to send a save event.



If the PDF has no edits, allow the browser to handle the save.



There should be no visible change for the existing PDF Viewer that uses

a GuestView and has nested WebContents.

entry.title: Avoid destruction of WebContents object if it's notifying observers
entry.content:
We are experiencing an increase in crashes during the installation of

WebApps when the app redirects or changes its manifest URL after the

loading of web app information has begun. In such cases, we attempt to

abort the installation and destroy the web content object created for

installation, but this triggers a CHECK that ensures web content is not

destroyed while notifying its observers.



To address this issue, we're posting a task to destroy WebContents which will ensure that it happens after observers are notified.

entry.title: Update virtual keyboard policy descriptions.
entry.content:
Some of the descriptions are misleading and not correct. Update them to

be correct:

- There's a difference between the ("touch") virtual keyboard and the

accessibility virtual keyboard. Make it clear which one the policy

controls.

- TouchVirtualKeyboardEnabled has nothing to do with tablet mode.

Whether the VK is shown or not is based on other heuristics, so make

that clear without explaining all different factors we use.

- Update OWNERS.



An upcoming CL will add a new policy that fills in the missing

login-screen version of TouchVirtualKeyboardEnabled.

entry.title: [Files F2] Allow custom equal function for selector
entry.content:
An optional isEqual is added for Selector class, which allows the

caller to pass a custom equaity comparison function used by

change detection. Two comparison functions are also added:

strictlyEqual and shallowEqual.



This is mainly to address the comparison issue when the combined

selector returns a plain object (e.g. {a: xxx, b: xxx}) which is

derived from other selectors. "shallowEqual" will only compare

the content (e.g. a's value and b's value), so even the object

reference changes every time, it won't trigger the change callback

as long as the content is not changed.

entry.title: manta: enable manta service by default
entry.content:
Manta service is shared by a number of features. Each feature has their

own feature flag and their own dogfood, release process. Having the

manta service flag off would require all feature teams to also manage

the manta flag in their own dogfood setup, which will cause error when

finch complains potential overlaping of population and controlling the

same feature flag with multiple studies.



This change enables manta service flag by default to allow each feature

team to control their feature with their respective flags.

entry.title: [MCT] Remove Fragment used for minimized card
entry.content:
Currently, we show the website information within a Fragment that gets

added to the hierarchy when we minimize the tab. Committing the showing

of the Fragment seems to happen after onSaveInstanceState, which causes

an IllegalStateException.



This CL removes the Fragment and updates the code to add and remove the

"card" manually, which is mostly what the Fragment does. This, however,

requires handling the Activity restarts too, which this CL also does.

entry.title: Revert "Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1aeb9ea2da6b1903b41ce61cd179482a49182c5b.



Reason for revert: Potential culprit for a consistent test failure.

Please see https://crbug.com/1515720 for more details.



Original change's description:

> Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study.

>

> This CL sets the necessary config to force tests to run with

> the same settings as the trial, with per-origin mode being the

> expected launch config.

>

> A number of WPTs fail in the new configuration dues to existing

> bugs. These are:

>

> ** Issue 1407078: beforeunload handlers triggered by window.close()

> don't work in OOPIFs

>

> fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose.html

> fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top.html

>

> ** Issue 1066891: TestDriver click is flaky with cross-origin frames:

>

> external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

>

> A number of WPTs have slightly different expected text output

> with the new feature, since some warning console message are

> treated differently for local vs. remote frames, and

> IsolateSandboxIframes causes some frames that used to be local

> to become remote.

> (In these cases, the existing expected output has been updated to

> match what a remote frame would show, with the original output

> copied to a flag-specific directory since the tests also run in

> the virtual test suite "disable-site-isolation-trials" without

> the IsolateSandboxIframes behavior).

>

> third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose-expected.txt

> third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-navigation-top-denied-expected.txt

> third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/security/no-popup-from-sandbox-top-expected.txt

> third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/security/sandboxed-iframe-form-top-expected.txt

>

> Bug: 510122, 1407078, 1066891

> Change-Id: Ib37e7d362c0e4362500232eb7bd454ae7096b12c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4982170

> Reviewed-by: David Bokan

> Reviewed-by: Charlie Reis

> Commit-Queue: W. James Maclean

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243051}



Bug: 510122, 1407078, 1066891

entry.title: Ensure there is always an active tab in nonempty TabStripModels.
entry.content:
- CHECK (NotFatalUntil::M124 to prevent stability issues) this invariant

whenever the selection is changed or tabs are added/removed.

- Activate the first tab added to an empty tabstrip, even if that is not

requested by `add_types`.

- Update tests accordingly, and add a new one covering the first-tab

activation behavior.

- Fix a crash in tab dragging introduced by activating the first tab

added to an empty tabstrip.



The tab dragging crash occurred when dragging an initially collapsed

group out into a new window. In that case, the group is created

collapsed in the new window, and immediately expanded upon adding the

first, active tab. However, the order of notifications in the

TabStripModel is such that the group isn't yet created in the TabStrip

when it goes to expand it; this of course crashes. I sidestep this

problem by creating the new group already expanded, but the more

fundamental preexisting issue in how TabStripModel and TabStrip

communicate during group creation is out of scope for this CL.



Bug: 1496583

Change-Id: I58b70dc43424e5d3a3dc76215813d8355d70ff0d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166847

entry.title: IDB: move some connection creation code to the bucket sequence.
entry.content:
Some code from IDBFactory::Open() moves to IndexedDBBucketContext.



The least straight-forward part is the `IndexedDBClientStateChecker`,

which is a mojo connection back to another thread in the browser

process. This interface is only used when opening a new connection, so

it's moved into IndexedDBPendingConnection.



Previously, one instance was held for each pairing of RFH and bucket,

and shared across multiple IDB connection requests. Now, since the

mojo pipe must be bound on the bucket sequence, a new remote is spawned

for each IDB connection request.



Bug: 1474996

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr. (sync)
entry.content:
This CL removes a use of base::SupportsWeakPtr from SyncableService

abstract base class by:



1. Adding a pure virtual function to return a base::WeakPtr.

2. Adding base::WeakPtrFactory class instances to the deriving

classes, if they don't already have one.

3. Implementing the function in the derived classes.



In most cases, leaf classes that have WeakPtrFactory instances are

marked as final for safety. However, there are some cases where test

classes extends some production classes, so they are not marked as

final. This can be fixed by expanding the class hierarchies, but that

adds more work and complexity, so I didn't pursue that.



Bug: 100114, 647430

Change-Id: Ia1e39071fd28130c8ea84e2282928350ddb43f9f
